alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 13 at 11:30AM CDT until July 13 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Sumter County in west central Alabama... * Until 200 PM CDT. * At 1130 AM CDT, Sumter County Emergency Management continued to report dangerous Flash Flooding ongoing in several locations throughout the county, including roads still deemed impassible. Between 6 and 8 inches of rain have fallen based on radar estimates this morning. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area through 2pm. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Demopolis, Livingston, York, Cuba, Gainesville, Epes, Emelle, The University Of West Alabama, Bluffport, Boyd, Coatopa, Dug Hill, Kinterbish, Geiger, Lilita, Old Mallard Airport, Bellamy, Sumterville, Payneville and Ward. The Flash Flood Warning has been extended until 2pm due to additional heavy rainfall moving into the area from Mississippi. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
